intro: Festuca ovina f. villosa, commonly known as hairy sheep's fescue, is a cool-season grass characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. It features wiry,丛生 stems covered with fine, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed sites such as roadsides and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It is a perennial species that produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny flowers. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally used in landscaping and erosion control.
